research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: School stopped functioning and is now closed (Examples include: Occupied by armed forces, Partially damaged, Totally damaged, Occupied by displaced persons, Lack of students)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Going or attending school is not safe (Examples include: it is unsafe to travel or go to school, Fear of recruitment in/on way to school, Fear of bombing, Fear of violence against children at school (corporal punishment, harassment by teachers and other students, bullying, etc.), Fear of abduction in/on way to school)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: We can’t afford to pay for the school related expenses (Examples include: Cannot afford to pay for the school fees (e.g. school supplies, tuition, textbook, food, uniforms, etc.), Cannot afford to pay for transport)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: We are not able to register or enrol our children in the school (Examples include: Recent or continuous movement to different locations, Newly arrived at location and have yet to enrol/register, Unable to enrol school due to discrimination, Poor performance/dismissed)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Our children can’t physically go to the school (Examples include: Disability (of child), Traumatization (of child), School is too far away, No transport available to bring to school, No fuel available to bring to school, Child ill, disabled or unhealthy, Child is too young)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: School and classes are overcrowded

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Lack of staff to run the school (Examples include: Lack of teachers, Lack of skilled/trained teachers, Lack of gender appropriate teachers/staff)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: The school infrastructure is poor (Examples include: The schools building is in poor condition (e.g. lack of furniture, no electricity, water leaks, poor latrines, poor amenities, etc.), The WASH facilities are in poor conditions (latrines maintenance, smell, lightning, gender segregation, etc.)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: The curriculum and teaching are not adapted for our children (Examples include: Curriculum is not appropriate; Language is not appropriate)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Our children are busy working or supporting the household (Examples include: Children need to stay at home and assist the family with household chores or contribute to HH income, Early marriage)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Parental refusal to send children to school (Examples include: Customs/tradition, Don't believe schooling is necessary/do not consider education important, Missed too much school to make up, Children shouldn't get western education)

research.question: Main barriers to school for school-aged children
sub.research.question: Lack of interest of children in education.

sub.research.question: Lack of valid documentation.
